channel.title: Comments on: Modal Dialog
channel.description: WordPress Plugins, Plugin Development Cookbook and random thoughts

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/modal-dialog/comment-page-8/#comment-30372">David Radovanovic</a>.
Hi David, First off, thanks for the donation. Now, it looks like a bunch of the parameters in the Modal Dialog configuration page were left empty, which is leading to an error message. Please try setting the width and height of the dialog OR check the Auto-Size Dialog box to let the dialog set its size automatically. Then we can see if there are any other errors.
You can install the Firebug plugin for Firefox, visit your site, run Firebug and look at the console to see if you have any scripting errors on your site.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to David Radovanovic.

Hi David, First off, thanks for the donation. Now, it looks like a bunch of the parameters in the Modal Dialog configuration page were left empty, which is leading to an error message. Please try setting the width and height of the dialog OR check the Auto-Size Dialog box to let the dialog set its size automatically. Then we can see if there are any other errors.

You can install the Firebug plugin for Firefox, visit your site, run Firebug and look at the console to see if you have any scripting errors on your site.

item.title: By: David Radovanovic
item.dc:creator: David Radovanovic
item.description: Great plugin! Is there any examples of using modal via a button or text? I tried implementing the text link here: http://www.armofthesea.org/participate/ (DONATE in list) though it doesn't open a modal window but rather the external page. Thanks!
item.content:encoded: Great plugin! Is there any examples of using modal via a button or text? I tried implementing the text link here: http://www.armofthesea.org/participate/ (DONATE in list) though it doesn’t open a modal window but rather the external page. Thanks!

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/modal-dialog/comment-page-8/#comment-29227">ramin</a>.
From what I can see, the plugin is not properly configured. Can you make sure it is set to display and that the front page option is checked?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to ramin.

From what I can see, the plugin is not properly configured. Can you make sure it is set to display and that the front page option is checked?

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/modal-dialog/comment-page-8/#comment-26510">mokas01</a>.
Did you look at the FAQ section under the Modal dialog menu? It shows how to get the dialog to open from a click.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to mokas01.

Did you look at the FAQ section under the Modal dialog menu? It shows how to get the dialog to open from a click.

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/modal-dialog/comment-page-8/#comment-26576">facebook_peter.reginald</a>.
You can use the parameter 'Javascript Dialog Closure Callback' to provide a javascript function to be called when the dialog closes. In that function, you could make the necessary call to stop the video playback.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to facebook_peter.reginald.

You can use the parameter ‘Javascript Dialog Closure Callback’ to provide a javascript function to be called when the dialog closes. In that function, you could make the necessary call to stop the video playback.

item.title: By: facebook_peter.reginald
item.dc:creator: facebook_peter.reginald
item.description:
Hi Yel. I am testing your modal plugin to display a youtube embedded video with the autoplay=1 option. This means that the youtube video will autoplay when loaded.
The problem I have is if the user closes the modal while the video continues to play (you can hear the audio).
Are you implementing a way to stop the youtube video playback if it's set to 'autoplay=1'?
Thanks, Peter
item.content:encoded:
Hi Yel. I am testing your modal plugin to display a youtube embedded video with the autoplay=1 option. This means that the youtube video will autoplay when loaded.

The problem I have is if the user closes the modal while the video continues to play (you can hear the audio).

Are you implementing a way to stop the youtube video playback if it’s set to ‘autoplay=1’?

Thanks, Peter

item.title: By: mokas01
item.dc:creator: mokas01
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/modal-dialog/comment-page-8/#comment-1500">yel</a>.
Hi !
Thank you for your useful tool. I also need to load it on a click. I might be dumb but when I use the code you just gave chris, an alert pops up and says "in openDialog". I surely missunderstood your explanation, but I just don't get it... Thanks !
item.content:encoded:
In reply to yel.

Hi !

Thank you for your useful tool. I also need to load it on a click. I might be dumb but when I use the code you just gave chris, an alert pops up and says “in openDialog”. I surely missunderstood your explanation, but I just don’t get it…
Thanks !

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/modal-dialog/comment-page-8/#comment-25936">Vijaya Narayanasamy</a>.
I am not sure I understand, you want the modal dialog window to follow responsive design? To do so, you would need to analyze the style of the window and write code for other screen resolutions in your stylesheet to change its style when the window becomes smaller. There is not much else to be done.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Vijaya Narayanasamy.

I am not sure I understand, you want the modal dialog window to follow responsive design? To do so, you would need to analyze the style of the window and write code for other screen resolutions in your stylesheet to change its style when the window becomes smaller. There is not much else to be done.
